content.question: The graph shows the position <math alttext="x" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> as a function of time <math alttext="t" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>t</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> of an object in linear motion. Which of the following graphs best represents the velocity <math alttext="v" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>v</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> of the object as a function of <math alttext="t" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>t</mi></mrow></mstyle></math>Â ?

choices.label: The figure presents a graph of a curve in a coordinate plane, with the origin labeled O. The horizontal axis is labeled t, and there are 4 tick marks evenly spaced along the horizontal axis. The vertical axis is labeled v. The curve begins on the vertical axis, above the origin. It moves horizontally to the right at first. At a point halfway between the second and third tick marks, the curve turns downward and to the right. It crosses the horizontal axis at the third tick mark, and continues downward until it reaches a point below the horizontal axis, just to the right of the third tick mark. At this point, the curve moves horizontally to the right until it ends.

The figure presents a graph of a curve in a coordinate plane, with the origin labeled O. The horizontal axis is labeled t, and there are 4 tick marks evenly spaced along the horizontal axis. The vertical axis is labeled v. The curve begins on the vertical axis, below the origin. It moves horizontally to the right at first. At a point halfway between the second and third tick marks, the curve turns upward and to the right. It crosses the horizontal axis at the third tick mark, and continues upward until it reaches a point above the horizontal axis, just to the right of the third tick mark. At this point, the curve moves horizontally to the right until it ends.

The figure presents a graph of a curve in a coordinate plane, with the origin labeled O. The horizontal axis is labeled t, and there are 4 tick marks evenly spaced along the horizontal axis. The vertical axis is labeled v. The curve begins on the vertical axis, below the origin, and moves upward and to the right, crossing the horizontal axis just to the right of the first tick mark. It continues upward and to the right until it reaches a maximum above the horizontal axis, at the third tick mark. It then moves downward and to the right until it ends on the horizontal axis at the fourth tick mark.

The figure presents a graph of a curve in a coordinate plane, with the origin labeled O. The horizontal axis is labeled t, and there are 4 tick marks evenly spaced along the horizontal axis. The vertical axis is labeled v. The curve begins on the vertical axis, below the origin. It moves horizontally to the right at first. At a point halfway between the first and second tick marks, the curve turns steeply upward and to the right. It crosses the horizontal axis just to the left of the second tick mark, and continues upward until it reaches a point above the horizontal axis, just to the right of the second tick mark. At this point, the curve moves horizontally to the right until it reaches a point just to the right of the third tick mark. At this point, the graph turns downward and to the right until it ends on the horizontal axis at the fourth tick mark.

The figure presents a graph of a curve in a coordinate plane, with the origin labeled O. The horizontal axis is labeled t, and there are 4 tick marks evenly spaced along the horizontal axis. The vertical axis is labeled v. The curve begins on the vertical axis, above the origin, and moves downward and to the right, crossing the horizontal axis just to the right of the first tick mark. It continues downward and to the right until it reaches a minimum below the horizontal axis, at the third tick mark. It then moves upward and to the right until it ends on the horizontal axis at the fourth tick mark.

content.answer: The figure presents a graph of a curve in a coordinate plane, with the origin labeled O. The horizontal axis is labeled t, and there are 4 tick marks evenly spaced along the horizontal axis. The vertical axis is labeled v. The curve begins on the vertical axis, above the origin. It moves horizontally to the right at first. At a point halfway between the second and third tick marks, the curve turns downward and to the right. It crosses the horizontal axis at the third tick mark, and continues downward until it reaches a point below the horizontal axis, just to the right of the third tick mark. At this point, the curve moves horizontally to the right until it ends.
